result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn W Boss was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol or drugs and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included. 

Receive counseling if any provided by probation.

Seek and obtain full time work and get his GED

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any treatment or programming ordered by the agent.
Obey all rules and regulations of the department.
Submit to AODA and follow all recommendations for treatment.

Pay costs, fees, and any surcharges.

Credit in the event of revocation: 6 days

Submit DNA sample at the Richland County Sheriff's Department.
Sign up for probation today

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shawn W Boss

records.addlTxt:
1:31 PM 2022CM000011, 2022CM000013, 2021CM0000173 - Defendant Shawn W Boss in court.  Attorney David L. Christian in court for Shawn W Boss.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Christian provides the plea questionnaire. Attorney Christian states the joint agreement to enter a plea on: 21CM173; count1, 22CM11; count 1 and 22CM13; count 1 and sentence to 2 year probation with conditions of AODA/Driver Safety plan, no drink/drug provision, counseling and court costs. All other counts will be dismissed. Defendant enters a plea on 21CM173 of guilty, 22CM11 of NC and 22CM13 of guilty. Court colloquy. 


21CM173- Count 1, 22CM11-Count 1, 22CM13 - Count 1
Court withholds sentence and orders probation for 2 years. 

Conditions:
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol or drugs and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included. 

Receive counseling if any  provided by probation.

Seek and obtain full time work and get his GED

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any treatment or programming ordered by the agent.
Obey all rules and regulations of the department.
Submit to AODA and follow all recommendations for treatment.

Pay costs, fees, and any surcharges on each count..

Credit in the event of revocation: 21CM173- 3 days; 22CM11-7 days; 22CM13-6 days

Submit DNA sample at the Richland County Sheriff's Department.
Sign up for probation today

All other counts will be DRI.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

01:12 PM 21CM173, 22CM11, 22CM13 - Attorney David L. Christian appeared by video means for Defendant Shawn W Boss. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Shawn W Boss appeared by phone means. Attorney Christan states that there is an offer that was given by  the state and would like a plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
for Leave to File Additional Motions
Status conference on March 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:00 AM 21CM173/22CM11/22CM13 - Defendant Shawn W Boss appeared by phone means. Prosecuting Atty Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney David L. Christian appeared by video means for Defendant Shawn W Boss. Attorney Christian waives the formal reading in 22MC11 and 22CM13 and enters a NG plea. Max penalties stated.  Status conference scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
2/8/22: $1000 cash bond lowered to $500 cash. Conditions remain the same: No contact with the residence or the victims. Next appearance will again be by Zoom. See connection information below.
Adjourned initial appearance on February 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

01:06 PM Defendant Shawn W Boss appeared by video means from the Richland County Jail, in custoday, for initial in 22CM11 and 22CM13 and status in 21CM173. Attorney David L. Christian appeared by video means for Defendant Shawn W Boss. Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin. Atty. Christian - Defense hasn't been able to review the newest complaint; asks for adjournment. Court sets matters over to this Friday. Def asks for modification of bond; Atty. Christian speaks on his behalf re the request; asks for $200 cash bond. Court lowers the $1000 cash bond in 22CM13 to $500. Def states he can't post that. Court states $500 is the order - same conditions. Matters reset to 2/11 at 10 a.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
No contact with the residence or the victims..

Appearances: Judge Sharp, SKK Court Reporter, ADA Forehand for the State, Defendant by video in RCSD Jail with Attorney Christian

Recommendation on bail from the State :
$1,000 Cash Bond
No contact with the residence (7 Bancroft Drive) and the victims. (ARW, ALVS, AMF)

Court Orders:
